title: To an Inconstant One - speaker explains that he

content.prompt: In lines 19-24, the speaker explains that he would have

choices.label: disappointed his lover if he had fallen in love with someone else
demeaned love by staying with his lover out of passivity rather than affection
denied himself true love by settling on the first woman available to him
shortchanged himself if he had courted another woman not good enough for him

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
